alert.note: Alert for Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Huerfano, east central Costilla and western Las Animas Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Cuchara, or 14 miles southwest of Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Huerfano, east central Costilla and western Las Animas Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft
